items.label: verif-density-bound-consistency-full
items.title: Self-Consistent Density Bound via Banach Fixed Point
items.content:
708: :label: verif-density-bound-consistency-full
709: 
710: Let $\rho_{\max}$ denote the phase-space density bound from Assumption {prf:ref}`assump-uniform-density-full`.
711: 
712: From {prf:ref}`doc-13-geometric-gas-c3-regularity`, there exist positive constants $L_0$ and $C_{\nabla V}$ (depending only on $\varepsilon_d$, $\varepsilon_c$, $\eta_{\min}$, and $\text{diam}(\mathcal{X} \times V)$) such that the Lipschitz constant of the fitness drift satisfies:
713: 
714: $$
715: L_V(\rho_{\max}) \leq L_0 + C_{\nabla V} \rho_{\max}
716: 
717: $$
718: 
719: Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-fokker-planck-density-bound-conservative-full` yields constants $A_0, A_1 > 0$ (set by $\gamma$, $T$, $V_{\max}$, and $\text{Vol}(\mathcal{X})$) with:
720: 
721: $$
722: C_{\text{FK}}(L_V) \leq A_0 + A_1 L_V
723: 
724: $$
725: 
726: and Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-qsd-density-bound-with-cloning-full` supplies $C_{\text{QSD}}>0$.
727: 
728: Define the map $T : [0,\rho_{\text{upper}}] \to [0,\rho_{\text{upper}}]$ by:
729: 
730: $$
731: T(\rho) := C_{\text{QSD}}\left(A_0 + A_1\left(L_0 + C_{\nabla V}\rho\right)\right) =: \beta_0 + \beta_1 \rho
732: 
733: $$
734: 
735: where $\beta_0 = C_{\text{QSD}}(A_0 + A_1 L_0)$ and $\beta_1 = C_{\text{QSD}} A_1 C_{\nabla V}$.
736: 
737: **If** $\beta_1 < 1$ (the Keystone parameter regime guarantees this because $A_1$ is $O((\gamma T)^{-1})$ while $C_{\nabla V}$ depends only on bounded geometric constants), **then** $T$ is a contraction on:
738: 
739: $$
740: [0,\rho_{\text{upper}}], \qquad \rho_{\text{upper}} := \frac{\beta_0}{1-\beta_1}
741: 
742: $$
743: 
744: Consequently, there exists a unique fixed point $\rho_{\max}^* \in [0,\rho_{\text{upper}}]$ with $\rho_{\max}^* = T(\rho_{\max}^*)$.
items.raw_directive:
705: :::
706: 
707: :::{prf:theorem} Self-Consistent Density Bound via Banach Fixed Point
708: :label: verif-density-bound-consistency-full
709: 
710: Let $\rho_{\max}$ denote the phase-space density bound from Assumption {prf:ref}`assump-uniform-density-full`.
711: 
712: From {prf:ref}`doc-13-geometric-gas-c3-regularity`, there exist positive constants $L_0$ and $C_{\nabla V}$ (depending only on $\varepsilon_d$, $\varepsilon_c$, $\eta_{\min}$, and $\text{diam}(\mathcal{X} \times V)$) such that the Lipschitz constant of the fitness drift satisfies:
713: 
714: $$
715: L_V(\rho_{\max}) \leq L_0 + C_{\nabla V} \rho_{\max}
716: 
717: $$
718: 
719: Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-fokker-planck-density-bound-conservative-full` yields constants $A_0, A_1 > 0$ (set by $\gamma$, $T$, $V_{\max}$, and $\text{Vol}(\mathcal{X})$) with:
720: 
721: $$
722: C_{\text{FK}}(L_V) \leq A_0 + A_1 L_V
723: 
724: $$
725: 
726: and Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-qsd-density-bound-with-cloning-full` supplies $C_{\text{QSD}}>0$.
727: 
728: Define the map $T : [0,\rho_{\text{upper}}] \to [0,\rho_{\text{upper}}]$ by:
729: 
730: $$
731: T(\rho) := C_{\text{QSD}}\left(A_0 + A_1\left(L_0 + C_{\nabla V}\rho\right)\right) =: \beta_0 + \beta_1 \rho
732: 
733: $$
734: 
735: where $\beta_0 = C_{\text{QSD}}(A_0 + A_1 L_0)$ and $\beta_1 = C_{\text{QSD}} A_1 C_{\nabla V}$.
736: 
737: **If** $\beta_1 < 1$ (the Keystone parameter regime guarantees this because $A_1$ is $O((\gamma T)^{-1})$ while $C_{\nabla V}$ depends only on bounded geometric constants), **then** $T$ is a contraction on:
738: 
739: $$
740: [0,\rho_{\text{upper}}], \qquad \rho_{\text{upper}} := \frac{\beta_0}{1-\beta_1}
741: 
742: $$
743: 
744: Consequently, there exists a unique fixed point $\rho_{\max}^* \in [0,\rho_{\text{upper}}]$ with $\rho_{\max}^* = T(\rho_{\max}^*)$.
745:

items.label: thm-diversity-pairing-measurement-regularity
items.title: C^∞ Regularity with K-Uniform Bounds (Diversity Pairing)
items.content:
2426: :label: thm-diversity-pairing-measurement-regularity
2427: 
2428: Using the diversity pairing mechanism (either idealized or sequential greedy), the expected measurement satisfies:
2429: 
2430: $$
2431: \|\nabla^m \bar{d}_i\|_{\infty} \leq C_m(\varepsilon_d, d, \rho_{\max}) \cdot m! \cdot \varepsilon_d^{-2m}
2432: 
2433: $$
items.raw_directive:
2423: ### 5.6.3 C^∞ Regularity of Diversity Pairing Measurements
2424: 
2425: :::{prf:theorem} C^∞ Regularity with K-Uniform Bounds (Diversity Pairing)
2426: :label: thm-diversity-pairing-measurement-regularity
2427: 
2428: Using the diversity pairing mechanism (either idealized or sequential greedy), the expected measurement satisfies:
2429: 
2430: $$
2431: \|\nabla^m \bar{d}_i\|_{\infty} \leq C_m(\varepsilon_d, d, \rho_{\max}) \cdot m! \cdot \varepsilon_d^{-2m}
2432: 
2433: $$
2434:

items.label: thm-statistical-equivalence-companion-mechanisms
items.title: Qualitative Statistical Equivalence of Companion Mechanisms
items.content:
2844: :label: thm-statistical-equivalence-companion-mechanisms
2845: 
2846: Let $\Delta_j(S) := \mathbb{E}_{\text{softmax}}[d_j | S] - \mathbb{E}_{\text{pair}}[d_j | S]$.
2847: 
2848: Under Assumption {prf:ref}`assump-uniform-density-full` and Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-companion-availability-enforcement`, the following hold for every configuration $S$ and walker $j$:
2849: 
2850: 1. **Uniform boundedness**:
2851: 
2852: $$
2853: |\Delta_j(S)| \leq D_{\max} := \text{diam}(\mathcal{X} \times V)
2854: 
2855: $$
2856: 
2857: 2. **Gevrey-1 regularity with identical parameter dependence**:
2858: 
2859: $$
2860: \|\nabla^m \Delta_j\| \leq \left(C_{d,m}^{(\text{soft})} + C_{d,m}^{(\text{pair})}\right) m! \max(\rho^{-m}, \varepsilon_d^{1-m})
2861: 
2862: $$
2863: 
2864: where $C_{d,m}^{(\text{soft})}$ (resp. $C_{d,m}^{(\text{pair})}$) are the k-uniform constants from Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-derivatives-companion-distance-full` and Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-diversity-pairing-measurement-regularity`.
2865: 
2866: 3. **Implementation-independence**: Every downstream quantity computed from $d_j$ (localized means, variances, Z-scores, and $V_{\text{fit}}$) retains the same derivative bounds whether softmax or diversity pairing is used, because the entire pipeline depends on $d_j$ only through sums of the form $\sum_j w_{ij}(\rho) d_j$ with $\sum_j w_{ij} = 1$.
items.section: ## 5.7 Statistical Equivalence and Unified Regularity Theorem
items.raw_directive:
2841: ### 5.7.2 Qualitative Statistical Equivalence
2842: 
2843: :::{prf:theorem} Qualitative Statistical Equivalence of Companion Mechanisms
2844: :label: thm-statistical-equivalence-companion-mechanisms
2845: 
2846: Let $\Delta_j(S) := \mathbb{E}_{\text{softmax}}[d_j | S] - \mathbb{E}_{\text{pair}}[d_j | S]$.
2847: 
2848: Under Assumption {prf:ref}`assump-uniform-density-full` and Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-companion-availability-enforcement`, the following hold for every configuration $S$ and walker $j$:
2849: 
2850: 1. **Uniform boundedness**:
2851: 
2852: $$
2853: |\Delta_j(S)| \leq D_{\max} := \text{diam}(\mathcal{X} \times V)
2854: 
2855: $$
2856: 
2857: 2. **Gevrey-1 regularity with identical parameter dependence**:
2858: 
2859: $$
2860: \|\nabla^m \Delta_j\| \leq \left(C_{d,m}^{(\text{soft})} + C_{d,m}^{(\text{pair})}\right) m! \max(\rho^{-m}, \varepsilon_d^{1-m})
2861: 
2862: $$
2863: 
2864: where $C_{d,m}^{(\text{soft})}$ (resp. $C_{d,m}^{(\text{pair})}$) are the k-uniform constants from Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-derivatives-companion-distance-full` and Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-diversity-pairing-measurement-regularity`.
2865: 
2866: 3. **Implementation-independence**: Every downstream quantity computed from $d_j$ (localized means, variances, Z-scores, and $V_{\text{fit}}$) retains the same derivative bounds whether softmax or diversity pairing is used, because the entire pipeline depends on $d_j$ only through sums of the form $\sum_j w_{ij}(\rho) d_j$ with $\sum_j w_{ij} = 1$.
2867:

_registry_context.section_id: ## 5.7 Statistical Equivalence and Unified Regularity Theorem

items.label: thm-unified-cinf-regularity-both-mechanisms
items.title: C^∞ Regularity of Companion-Dependent Fitness Potential (Both Mechanisms)
items.content:
2905: :label: thm-unified-cinf-regularity-both-mechanisms
2906: 
2907: Under the framework assumptions (kinetic regularization providing density bound, companion availability, regularization parameters $\varepsilon_d, \varepsilon_c > 0$), the fitness potential:
2908: 
2909: $$
2910: V_{\text{fit}}(x_i, v_i) = g_A\left(Z_\rho\left(\mu_\rho^{(i)}, \sigma_\rho^{2(i)}\right)\right)
2911: 
2912: $$
2913: 
2914: computed with **either** companion selection mechanism (independent softmax or diversity pairing) is **C^∞** for all $(x_i, v_i) \in \mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d$.
2915: 
2916: **Derivative Bounds** (k-uniform Gevrey-1): For all $m \geq 0$:
2917: 
2918: $$
2919: \|\nabla^m_{x_i, v_i} V_{\text{fit}}\|_\infty \leq C_{V,m} \cdot \max(\rho^{-m}, \varepsilon_d^{1-m}, \eta_{\min}^{1-m})
2920: 
2921: $$
2922: 
2923: where $C_{V,m} = \mathcal{O}(m!)$ (Gevrey-1) is **k-uniform** (independent of swarm size $k$ or $N$) and depends only on:
2924: - Algorithmic parameters: $\rho$ (localization scale), $\varepsilon_c$ (companion selection temperature), $\varepsilon_d$ (distance regularization), $\eta_{\min}$ (variance regularization—see §12.3 for derivation from quotient rule in $\sigma'_\rho = \sqrt{\sigma_\rho^2 + \eta^2}$)
2925: - Dimension: $d$
2926: - Density bound: $\rho_{\max}$ (derived from kinetic dynamics)
2927: 
2928: **Mechanism Equivalence**:
2929: - **Regularity class**: IDENTICAL - Both mechanisms achieve C^∞ with k-uniform Gevrey-1 bounds
2930: - **Quantitative difference**: $\|V_{\text{fit}}^{\text{soft}} - V_{\text{fit}}^{\text{pair}}\| = O(k^{-1} \log^{d+1/2} k)$
items.section: ## 5.7 Statistical Equivalence and Unified Regularity Theorem
items.raw_directive:
2902: ### 5.7.3 Unified Main Theorem
2903: 
2904: :::{prf:theorem} C^∞ Regularity of Companion-Dependent Fitness Potential (Both Mechanisms)
2905: :label: thm-unified-cinf-regularity-both-mechanisms
2906: 
2907: Under the framework assumptions (kinetic regularization providing density bound, companion availability, regularization parameters $\varepsilon_d, \varepsilon_c > 0$), the fitness potential:
2908: 
2909: $$
2910: V_{\text{fit}}(x_i, v_i) = g_A\left(Z_\rho\left(\mu_\rho^{(i)}, \sigma_\rho^{2(i)}\right)\right)
2911: 
2912: $$
2913: 
2914: computed with **either** companion selection mechanism (independent softmax or diversity pairing) is **C^∞** for all $(x_i, v_i) \in \mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d$.
2915: 
2916: **Derivative Bounds** (k-uniform Gevrey-1): For all $m \geq 0$:
2917: 
2918: $$
2919: \|\nabla^m_{x_i, v_i} V_{\text{fit}}\|_\infty \leq C_{V,m} \cdot \max(\rho^{-m}, \varepsilon_d^{1-m}, \eta_{\min}^{1-m})
2920: 
2921: $$
2922: 
2923: where $C_{V,m} = \mathcal{O}(m!)$ (Gevrey-1) is **k-uniform** (independent of swarm size $k$ or $N$) and depends only on:
2924: - Algorithmic parameters: $\rho$ (localization scale), $\varepsilon_c$ (companion selection temperature), $\varepsilon_d$ (distance regularization), $\eta_{\min}$ (variance regularization—see §12.3 for derivation from quotient rule in $\sigma'_\rho = \sqrt{\sigma_\rho^2 + \eta^2}$)
2925: - Dimension: $d$
2926: - Density bound: $\rho_{\max}$ (derived from kinetic dynamics)
2927: 
2928: **Mechanism Equivalence**:
2929: - **Regularity class**: IDENTICAL - Both mechanisms achieve C^∞ with k-uniform Gevrey-1 bounds
2930: - **Quantitative difference**: $\|V_{\text{fit}}^{\text{soft}} - V_{\text{fit}}^{\text{pair}}\| = O(k^{-1} \log^{d+1/2} k)$
2931:   - **Practical significance**: Depends on dimension $d$ (see §5.7.2 for dimension-dependent assessment)

_registry_context.section_id: ## 5.7 Statistical Equivalence and Unified Regularity Theorem

items.label: thm-k-uniformity-telescoping-full
items.title: k-Uniformity via Telescoping Cancellation
items.content:
3175: :label: thm-k-uniformity-telescoping-full
3176: 
3177: For the localized mean $\mu_\rho^{(i)} = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} w_{ij}(\rho) \cdot d_j$, the $m$-th derivative satisfies:
3178: 
3179: $$
3180: \|\nabla^m_{x_i} \mu_\rho^{(i)}\| \leq C_m(\rho, \varepsilon_c, \varepsilon_d, d) \cdot m!
3181: 
3182: $$
3183: 
3184: where $C_m$ is **independent of $k$** (the number of alive walkers).
3185: 
3186: **Key mechanism**: Although the sum contains $k$ terms, the telescoping identity ensures that the $k$ dependence cancels in the derivative.
items.raw_directive:
3172: We now show explicitly how the telescoping identity controls $j$-summations at $\rho$-scale (localization weights $w_{ij}$) to yield k-uniform bounds. Note: This addresses the $j$-sum only; the $\ell$-sum from softmax (scale $\varepsilon_c$) is handled separately via derivative locality (§7.1).
3173: 
3174: :::{prf:theorem} k-Uniformity via Telescoping Cancellation
3175: :label: thm-k-uniformity-telescoping-full
3176: 
3177: For the localized mean $\mu_\rho^{(i)} = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} w_{ij}(\rho) \cdot d_j$, the $m$-th derivative satisfies:
3178: 
3179: $$
3180: \|\nabla^m_{x_i} \mu_\rho^{(i)}\| \leq C_m(\rho, \varepsilon_c, \varepsilon_d, d) \cdot m!
3181: 
3182: $$
3183: 
3184: where $C_m$ is **independent of $k$** (the number of alive walkers).
3185: 
3186: **Key mechanism**: Although the sum contains $k$ terms, the telescoping identity ensures that the $k$ dependence cancels in the derivative.
3187:

items.label: thm-cluster-localized-derivative-bounds-full
items.title: Cluster-Localized Derivative Bounds
items.content:
3322: :label: thm-cluster-localized-derivative-bounds-full
3323: 
3324: Using the smooth partition $\{\psi_m\}$ from {prf:ref}`def-smooth-phase-space-partition-full`, the derivative $\partial d_j / \partial x_i$ satisfies:
3325: 
3326: $$
3327: \left\|\frac{\partial d_j}{\partial x_i}\right\| \leq \sum_{m,m'=1}^M \psi_m(x_i, v_i) \cdot \psi_{m'}(x_j, v_j) \cdot C_{i \leftrightarrow j}^{(m,m')}
3328: 
3329: $$
3330: 
3331: where:
items.raw_directive:
3319: The key to controlling this N-body coupling is the **smooth clustering framework**:
3320: 
3321: :::{prf:theorem} Cluster-Localized Derivative Bounds
3322: :label: thm-cluster-localized-derivative-bounds-full
3323: 
3324: Using the smooth partition $\{\psi_m\}$ from {prf:ref}`def-smooth-phase-space-partition-full`, the derivative $\partial d_j / \partial x_i$ satisfies:
3325: 
3326: $$
3327: \left\|\frac{\partial d_j}{\partial x_i}\right\| \leq \sum_{m,m'=1}^M \psi_m(x_i, v_i) \cdot \psi_{m'}(x_j, v_j) \cdot C_{i \leftrightarrow j}^{(m,m')}
3328: 
3329: $$
3330: 
3331: where:
3332: - **Intra-cluster coupling** ($m = m'$): $C_{i \leftrightarrow j}^{(m,m)} = \mathcal{O}(1)$ when $d_{\text{alg}}(i,j) \leq 2\varepsilon_c$

items.label: thm-mth-derivative-localized-variance-full
items.title: m-th Derivative of Localized Variance
items.raw_directive:
3942: ### 9.2 Inductive Analysis for Higher Derivatives
3943: 
3944: :::{prf:theorem} m-th Derivative of Localized Variance
3945: :label: thm-mth-derivative-localized-variance-full
3946: 
3947: For derivative order $m \geq 1$:
3948: 
3949: $$
3950: \|\nabla^m_{x_i} \sigma_\rho^{2(i)}\| \leq C_{\sigma^2,m}(\rho) \cdot \rho^{-m}
3951: 
3952: $$
3953:

items.label: thm-cinf-regularity-zscore-full
items.title: C^∞ Regularity of Z-Score
items.content:
4405: :label: thm-cinf-regularity-zscore-full
4406: 
4407: The Z-score $Z_\rho^{(i)}$ is C^∞ with respect to $(x_i, v_i)$ with derivative bounds:
4408: 
4409: For $m \geq 1$:
4410: 
4411: $$
4412: \|\nabla^m Z_\rho^{(i)}\| \leq C_{Z,m}(\rho) \cdot \rho^{-m}
4413: 
4414: $$
items.raw_directive:
4402: ### 11.1 C^∞ Regularity of Z-Score
4403: 
4404: :::{prf:theorem} C^∞ Regularity of Z-Score
4405: :label: thm-cinf-regularity-zscore-full
4406: 
4407: The Z-score $Z_\rho^{(i)}$ is C^∞ with respect to $(x_i, v_i)$ with derivative bounds:
4408: 
4409: For $m \geq 1$:
4410: 
4411: $$
4412: \|\nabla^m Z_\rho^{(i)}\| \leq C_{Z,m}(\rho) \cdot \rho^{-m}
4413: 
4414: $$
4415:

items.label: thm-main-cinf-regularity-fitness-potential-full
items.title: C^∞ Regularity of Fitness Potential (Main Result)
items.content:
4550: :label: thm-main-cinf-regularity-fitness-potential-full
4551: 
4552: The fitness potential:
4553: 
4554: $$
4555: V_{\text{fit}}(x_i, v_i) = g_A(Z_\rho^{(i)})
4556: 
4557: $$
4558: 
4559: is **C^∞** with respect to $(x_i, v_i)$ for all walkers $i \in \mathcal{A}$.
4560: 
4561: Moreover, for all derivative orders $m \geq 1$:
4562: 
4563: $$
4564: \|\nabla^m V_{\text{fit}}\|_\infty \leq C_{V,m}(d, \rho, \varepsilon_c, \eta_{\min}) \cdot \max(\rho^{-m}, \varepsilon_d^{1-m})
4565: 
4566: $$
4567: 
4568: where:
4569: 
4570: $$
4571: C_{V,m}(d, \rho, \varepsilon_c, \eta_{\min}) = \mathcal{O}(m! \cdot d^m \cdot \rho^{2dm} \cdot \eta_{\min}^{-(2m+1)} \cdot L_{g,m})
4572: 
4573: $$
4574: 
4575: is **independent of $k$, $N$, and walker index $i$** (k-uniform, N-uniform).
4576: 
4577: **Note on parameter separation**: The $\varepsilon_d$ dependence appears exclusively in the outer $\max(\rho^{-m}, \varepsilon_d^{1-m})$ term, not in $C_{V,m}$, to avoid redundancy. This clean separation reflects that $\varepsilon_d$ controls the dominant scaling regime while $C_{V,m}$ captures combinatorial and geometric factors.
4578: 
4579: For typical parameters where $\varepsilon_d \ll \varepsilon_c$ and $m \geq 2$, the $\varepsilon_d^{1-m}$ term dominates, giving:
4580: 
4581: $$
4582: \|\nabla^m V_{\text{fit}}\|_\infty \leq C_{V,m} \cdot \varepsilon_d^{1-m}
4583: 
4584: $$
4585: 
4586: The constant exhibits **Gevrey-1 growth**: $C_{V,m} = \mathcal{O}(m!)$ with explicit dependence on:
4587: - Dimension $d$ (polynomial)
4588: - Regularization parameters $\varepsilon_d$, $\eta_{\min}$ (inverse scaling for uniform bounds)
4589: - Localization scale $\rho$ (exponential locality)
4590: 
4591: The $\varepsilon_d^{1-m}$ factor enters through companion derivatives ({prf:ref}`lem-companion-measurement-derivatives-full`), making distance regularization the bottleneck for high-order derivative bounds.
items.section: ## 12. Fitness Potential: Composition with Rescale Function
items.raw_directive:
4547: ### 12.2 Final Composition: Chain Rule
4548: 
4549: :::{prf:theorem} C^∞ Regularity of Fitness Potential (Main Result)
4550: :label: thm-main-cinf-regularity-fitness-potential-full
4551: 
4552: The fitness potential:
4553: 
4554: $$
4555: V_{\text{fit}}(x_i, v_i) = g_A(Z_\rho^{(i)})
4556: 
4557: $$
4558: 
4559: is **C^∞** with respect to $(x_i, v_i)$ for all walkers $i \in \mathcal{A}$.
4560: 
4561: Moreover, for all derivative orders $m \geq 1$:
4562: 
4563: $$
4564: \|\nabla^m V_{\text{fit}}\|_\infty \leq C_{V,m}(d, \rho, \varepsilon_c, \eta_{\min}) \cdot \max(\rho^{-m}, \varepsilon_d^{1-m})
4565: 
4566: $$
4567: 
4568: where:
4569: 
4570: $$
4571: C_{V,m}(d, \rho, \varepsilon_c, \eta_{\min}) = \mathcal{O}(m! \cdot d^m \cdot \rho^{2dm} \cdot \eta_{\min}^{-(2m+1)} \cdot L_{g,m})
4572: 
4573: $$
4574: 
4575: is **independent of $k$, $N$, and walker index $i$** (k-uniform, N-uniform).
4576: 
4577: **Note on parameter separation**: The $\varepsilon_d$ dependence appears exclusively in the outer $\max(\rho^{-m}, \varepsilon_d^{1-m})$ term, not in $C_{V,m}$, to avoid redundancy. This clean separation reflects that $\varepsilon_d$ controls the dominant scaling regime while $C_{V,m}$ captures combinatorial and geometric factors.
4578: 
4579: For typical parameters where $\varepsilon_d \ll \varepsilon_c$ and $m \geq 2$, the $\varepsilon_d^{1-m}$ term dominates, giving:
4580: 
4581: $$
4582: \|\nabla^m V_{\text{fit}}\|_\infty \leq C_{V,m} \cdot \varepsilon_d^{1-m}
4583: 
4584: $$
4585: 
4586: The constant exhibits **Gevrey-1 growth**: $C_{V,m} = \mathcal{O}(m!)$ with explicit dependence on:
4587: - Dimension $d$ (polynomial)
4588: - Regularization parameters $\varepsilon_d$, $\eta_{\min}$ (inverse scaling for uniform bounds)
4589: - Localization scale $\rho$ (exponential locality)
4590: 
4591: The $\varepsilon_d^{1-m}$ factor enters through companion derivatives ({prf:ref}`lem-companion-measurement-derivatives-full`), making distance regularization the bottleneck for high-order derivative bounds.
4592:

_registry_context.section_id: ## 12. Fitness Potential: Composition with Rescale Function

items.label: thm-main-complete-cinf-geometric-gas-full
items.title: C^∞ Regularity of Geometric Gas with Companion-Dependent Fitness (Complete)
items.content:
4801: :label: thm-main-complete-cinf-geometric-gas-full
4802: 
4803: Consider the Geometric Gas algorithm with **regularized** companion-dependent measurements:
4804: 
4805: $$
4806: d_j = d_{\text{alg}}(j, c(j)) = \sqrt{\|x_j - x_{c(j)}\|^2 + \lambda_{\text{alg}} \|v_j - v_{c(j)}\|^2 + \varepsilon_d^2}
4807: 
4808: $$
4809: 
4810: where:
4811: - $\varepsilon_d > 0$ is the **distance regularization parameter** (eliminates singularity at walker collisions)
4812: - Companions $c(j) \in \mathcal{A} \setminus \{j\}$ are selected via softmax:
4813: 
4814: $$
4815: \mathbb{P}(c(j) = \ell) = \frac{\exp(-d_{\text{alg}}^2(j,\ell)/(2\varepsilon_c^2))}{\sum_{\ell' \in \mathcal{A} \setminus \{j\}} \exp(-d_{\text{alg}}^2(j,\ell')/(2\varepsilon_c^2))}
4816: 
4817: $$
4818: 
4819: Under the framework assumptions:
4820: - {prf:ref}`lem-companion-availability-enforcement` (minimum companion within $\mathcal{O}(\varepsilon_c)$)
4821: - {prf:ref}`assump-uniform-density-full` (bounded phase-space density)
4822: - {prf:ref}`assump-rescale-function-cinf-full` (C^∞ rescale function)
4823: 
4824: The **complete fitness potential**:
4825: 
4826: $$
4827: V_{\text{fit}}(x_i, v_i) = g_A\left(\frac{d_i - \mu_\rho^{(i)}}{\sigma'_\rho(i)}\right)
4828: 
4829: $$
4830: 
4831: where:
4832: - $\mu_\rho^{(i)} = \sum_{j} w_{ij}(\rho) d_j$ (localized mean)
4833: - $\sigma'_\rho(i) = \sqrt{\sum_j w_{ij}(\rho)(d_j - \mu_\rho)^2 + \eta_{\min}^2}$ (regularized std dev)
4834: - $w_{ij}(\rho) = \exp(-d_{\text{alg}}^2(i,j)/(2\rho^2)) / Z_i(\rho)$ (localization weights)
4835: 
4836: is **infinitely differentiable** (C^∞) with respect to $(x_i, v_i)$ for all walkers $i \in \mathcal{A}$.
4837: 
4838: **Derivative Bounds**: For all $m \geq 1$:
4839: 
4840: $$
4841: \|\nabla^m V_{\text{fit}}\|_\infty \leq C_{\text{Gev}}^m \cdot m! \cdot \rho_{\max}^{m} \cdot \rho^{2dm} \cdot \eta_{\min}^{-(2m+1)} \cdot \max(\rho^{-m}, \varepsilon_d^{1-m})
4842: 
4843: $$
4844: 
4845: where:
4846: - $C_{\text{Gev}}$ depends only on $d$, $\lambda_{\text{alg}}$, and the C^∞ norms of $g_A$
4847: - $\rho_{\max}$ is the self-consistent density bound from Theorem {prf:ref}`verif-density-bound-consistency-full`
4848: - The constants grow factorially with $m$ (Gevrey-1 classification)
4849: - Polynomial growth $\rho^{2dm}$ from localization and $\rho_{\max}^m$ from density bound
4850: - Inverse polynomial growth $\eta_{\min}^{-(2m+1)}$ from Z-score denominator regularization
4851: - The $\max(\rho^{-m}, \varepsilon_d^{1-m})$ term: for $m \geq 2$, typically $\varepsilon_d^{1-m}$ dominates (distance regularization bottleneck)
4852: 
4853: **Parameter dependencies exhibit**:
4854: - **Factorial growth** in derivative order $m$ (Gevrey-1)
4855: - **Polynomial growth** in dimension via $\rho^{2dm}$ (exponential locality)
4856: - **Inverse super-polynomial growth** in $\eta_{\min}^{-(2m+1)}$ (Z-score regularization)
4857: - **Inverse polynomial growth** in $\varepsilon_d^{1-m}$ for $m \geq 2$ (distance regularization)
4858: 
4859: The constant is **independent of** (uniformity properties):
4860: 1. Total swarm size $N$ (N-uniformity: bounds do not grow with total swarm population)
4861: 2. Number of alive walkers $k = |\mathcal{A}|$ (k-uniformity: independent of how many walkers remain alive)
4862: 3. Walker index $i$ (permutation invariance: all walkers treated symmetrically)
4863: 4. Walker configurations (uniform over state space: bounds hold regardless of walker positions)
items.raw_directive:
4798: We now state the complete main theorem, synthesizing all previous results.
4799: 
4800: :::{prf:theorem} C^∞ Regularity of Geometric Gas with Companion-Dependent Fitness (Complete)
4801: :label: thm-main-complete-cinf-geometric-gas-full
4802: 
4803: Consider the Geometric Gas algorithm with **regularized** companion-dependent measurements:
4804: 
4805: $$
4806: d_j = d_{\text{alg}}(j, c(j)) = \sqrt{\|x_j - x_{c(j)}\|^2 + \lambda_{\text{alg}} \|v_j - v_{c(j)}\|^2 + \varepsilon_d^2}
4807: 
4808: $$
4809: 
4810: where:
4811: - $\varepsilon_d > 0$ is the **distance regularization parameter** (eliminates singularity at walker collisions)
4812: - Companions $c(j) \in \mathcal{A} \setminus \{j\}$ are selected via softmax:
4813: 
4814: $$
4815: \mathbb{P}(c(j) = \ell) = \frac{\exp(-d_{\text{alg}}^2(j,\ell)/(2\varepsilon_c^2))}{\sum_{\ell' \in \mathcal{A} \setminus \{j\}} \exp(-d_{\text{alg}}^2(j,\ell')/(2\varepsilon_c^2))}
4816: 
4817: $$
4818: 
4819: Under the framework assumptions:
4820: - {prf:ref}`lem-companion-availability-enforcement` (minimum companion within $\mathcal{O}(\varepsilon_c)$)
4821: - {prf:ref}`assump-uniform-density-full` (bounded phase-space density)
4822: - {prf:ref}`assump-rescale-function-cinf-full` (C^∞ rescale function)
4823: 
4824: The **complete fitness potential**:
4825: 
4826: $$
4827: V_{\text{fit}}(x_i, v_i) = g_A\left(\frac{d_i - \mu_\rho^{(i)}}{\sigma'_\rho(i)}\right)
4828: 
4829: $$
4830: 
4831: where:
4832: - $\mu_\rho^{(i)} = \sum_{j} w_{ij}(\rho) d_j$ (localized mean)
4833: - $\sigma'_\rho(i) = \sqrt{\sum_j w_{ij}(\rho)(d_j - \mu_\rho)^2 + \eta_{\min}^2}$ (regularized std dev)
4834: - $w_{ij}(\rho) = \exp(-d_{\text{alg}}^2(i,j)/(2\rho^2)) / Z_i(\rho)$ (localization weights)
4835: 
4836: is **infinitely differentiable** (C^∞) with respect to $(x_i, v_i)$ for all walkers $i \in \mathcal{A}$.
4837: 
4838: **Derivative Bounds**: For all $m \geq 1$:
4839: 
4840: $$
4841: \|\nabla^m V_{\text{fit}}\|_\infty \leq C_{\text{Gev}}^m \cdot m! \cdot \rho_{\max}^{m} \cdot \rho^{2dm} \cdot \eta_{\min}^{-(2m+1)} \cdot \max(\rho^{-m}, \varepsilon_d^{1-m})
4842: 
4843: $$
4844: 
4845: where:
4846: - $C_{\text{Gev}}$ depends only on $d$, $\lambda_{\text{alg}}$, and the C^∞ norms of $g_A$
4847: - $\rho_{\max}$ is the self-consistent density bound from Theorem {prf:ref}`verif-density-bound-consistency-full`
4848: - The constants grow factorially with $m$ (Gevrey-1 classification)
4849: - Polynomial growth $\rho^{2dm}$ from localization and $\rho_{\max}^m$ from density bound
4850: - Inverse polynomial growth $\eta_{\min}^{-(2m+1)}$ from Z-score denominator regularization
4851: - The $\max(\rho^{-m}, \varepsilon_d^{1-m})$ term: for $m \geq 2$, typically $\varepsilon_d^{1-m}$ dominates (distance regularization bottleneck)
4852: 
4853: **Parameter dependencies exhibit**:
4854: - **Factorial growth** in derivative order $m$ (Gevrey-1)
4855: - **Polynomial growth** in dimension via $\rho^{2dm}$ (exponential locality)
4856: - **Inverse super-polynomial growth** in $\eta_{\min}^{-(2m+1)}$ (Z-score regularization)
4857: - **Inverse polynomial growth** in $\varepsilon_d^{1-m}$ for $m \geq 2$ (distance regularization)
4858: 
4859: The constant is **independent of** (uniformity properties):
4860: 1. Total swarm size $N$ (N-uniformity: bounds do not grow with total swarm population)
4861: 2. Number of alive walkers $k = |\mathcal{A}|$ (k-uniformity: independent of how many walkers remain alive)
4862: 3. Walker index $i$ (permutation invariance: all walkers treated symmetrically)
4863: 4. Walker configurations (uniform over state space: bounds hold regardless of walker positions)
4864:

items.label: thm-hypoellipticity-companion-dependent-full
items.title: Hypoellipticity with Companion-Dependent Fitness
items.content:
4912: :label: thm-hypoellipticity-companion-dependent-full
4913: 
4914: The Geometric Gas generator:
4915: 
4916: $$
4917: \mathcal{L}_{\text{geo}} = \sum_{i=1}^k \left[v_i \cdot \nabla_{x_i} - \nabla_{x_i} U(x_i) \cdot \nabla_{v_i} - \gamma v_i \cdot \nabla_{v_i} + \frac{\sigma^2}{2} \Delta_{v_i} - \varepsilon_F \nabla_{x_i} V_{\text{fit}}(x_i, v_i) \cdot \nabla_{v_i}\right]
4918: 
4919: $$
4920: 
4921: is **hypoelliptic** in the sense of Hörmander.
items.section: ## 14. Hypoellipticity of the Geometric Gas Generator
items.raw_directive:
4909: The C^∞ regularity of $V_{\text{fit}}$ has profound implications for the spectral properties of the Geometric Gas Langevin operator.
4910: 
4911: :::{prf:theorem} Hypoellipticity with Companion-Dependent Fitness
4912: :label: thm-hypoellipticity-companion-dependent-full
4913: 
4914: The Geometric Gas generator:
4915: 
4916: $$
4917: \mathcal{L}_{\text{geo}} = \sum_{i=1}^k \left[v_i \cdot \nabla_{x_i} - \nabla_{x_i} U(x_i) \cdot \nabla_{v_i} - \gamma v_i \cdot \nabla_{v_i} + \frac{\sigma^2}{2} \Delta_{v_i} - \varepsilon_F \nabla_{x_i} V_{\text{fit}}(x_i, v_i) \cdot \nabla_{v_i}\right]
4918: 
4919: $$
4920: 
4921: is **hypoelliptic** in the sense of Hörmander.
4922:

items.label: thm-faa-di-bruno-appendix
items.title: Faà di Bruno Formula for Higher-Order Chain Rule
items.content:
5291: :label: thm-faa-di-bruno-appendix
5292: 
5293: For smooth functions $f: \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ and $g: \mathbb{R}^d \to \mathbb{R}$, the $m$-th derivative of the composition $h = f \circ g$ is:
5294: 
5295: $$
5296: \nabla^m h(x) = \sum_{\pi \in \mathcal{P}_m} f^{(|\pi|)}(g(x)) \cdot B_\pi(\nabla g(x), \nabla^2 g(x), \ldots, \nabla^m g(x))
5297: 
5298: $$
5299: 
5300: where:
5301: - $\mathcal{P}_m$ is the set of all partitions of $\{1, 2, \ldots, m\}$
5302: - $|\pi|$ is the number of blocks in partition $\pi$
5303: - $B_\pi$ is the **Bell polynomial** associated with partition $\pi$
items.section: ## Appendix A: Combinatorial Proof of Gevrey-1 Bounds via Faà di Bruno Formula
items.raw_directive:
5288: ### A.1 Statement of the Faà di Bruno Formula
5289: 
5290: :::{prf:theorem} Faà di Bruno Formula for Higher-Order Chain Rule
5291: :label: thm-faa-di-bruno-appendix
5292: 
5293: For smooth functions $f: \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ and $g: \mathbb{R}^d \to \mathbb{R}$, the $m$-th derivative of the composition $h = f \circ g$ is:
5294: 
5295: $$
5296: \nabla^m h(x) = \sum_{\pi \in \mathcal{P}_m} f^{(|\pi|)}(g(x)) \cdot B_\pi(\nabla g(x), \nabla^2 g(x), \ldots, \nabla^m g(x))
5297: 
5298: $$
5299: 
5300: where:
5301: - $\mathcal{P}_m$ is the set of all partitions of $\{1, 2, \ldots, m\}$
5302: - $|\pi|$ is the number of blocks in partition $\pi$
5303: - $B_\pi$ is the **Bell polynomial** associated with partition $\pi$
5304:

_registry_context.section_id: ## Appendix A: Combinatorial Proof of Gevrey-1 Bounds via Faà di Bruno Formula
